data.title: Decoding pairs
data.statement:
You need to decode [[text]] based on pairs of ASCII printable characters that are each other's encoding. Any character of [[text]] not available in one of the pairs is not encoded.

<<Example>>
{{test}} with the pairs
`e a
f t` becomes {{fasf}}

testCases.title: A bit more
testCases.testIn:
bevebse alpyeb: apttebn dlepb?
3
r b
p a
c d

testCases.title: Validator 2
testCases.testIn:
I pe hedo se fer jeu.
3
o e
p d
y j
testCases.testOut: I do hope so for you.

testCases.title: Some other characters
testCases.testIn:
ASCII d-*s n-t -n^y r-nr*cn th* a^phab*t!
5
e *
. !
- o
l ^
c r
testCases.testOut: ASCII does not only concern the alphabet.

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn:
In f0&t; ASCII h0s m0ny mroe &h0o0&teos?
5
, ;
? .
a 0
& c
r o
testCases.testOut: In fact, ASCII has many more characters.

testCases.title: Capitals
testCases.testIn:
cOpitOIs OrA diffArAnt eScll ChOrOCtArs thOn thAir non-COpitOI AquivOIAnt.
4
c C
A e
a O
I l
testCases.testOut: Capitals are different ASCII characters than their non-capital equivalent.

testCases.title: Validator 5
testCases.testIn:
Yup, oSCii thInks i End I Ere dIVVerent chErEcters.
4
i I
A o
E a
f V
testCases.testOut: Yup, ASCII thinks I and i are different characters.

testCases.title: Long and all
testCases.testIn:
dr*s *s c*?T 0v trE v*?.l tEst, s0 tr.t *s wry *t *s . b*t l0?gEh tr.? trE 0trEhsa Iv y0V m.?.gET t0 v*?T tr*s l0?g tExt, I gVEss *t w0VlT bE t*mE t0 sVbm*ta
10
a .
* i
e E
T d
k c
0 o
u V
f v
h r
? n
testCases.testOut: This is kind of the final test, so that is why it is a bit longer than the others. If you managed to find this long text, I guess it would be time to submit.

testCases.title: Validator 6
testCases.testIn:
W*ll, thI3 u!lIT!t8r 3*?t*?K* 3h8vlT !l38 w8rk IV !ll th* 8th*r t*3t3 w8rk. it I3 b!3IK!lly th* 3!m* prI?KIpl*, bvt th*? 3Imply ! bIt l8?g*r th!? th* 8th*r3.
10
! a
* e
I i
d T
K c
o 8
u v
f V
s 3
? n
testCases.testOut: Well, this validator sentence should also work if all the other tests work. It is basically the same principle, but then simply a bit longer than the others.

data.constraints:
[[text]] consists only out of printable ASCII characters. 
Characters in every [[pair]] are  only printable ASCII characters, and every character in every [[pair]] is used maximum once.
0<=[[npairs]]<=10.
data.stubGenerator:
read text:string(200)
read npairs:int
loop npairs read pair:string(3)
write decoded string
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> string [[text]]: the text to decode.
<<Line 2:>> integer [[npairs]], number of encoding pairs.
<<Next [[npairs]] lines:>> string [[pair]], space separated pair of characters that are each other's encoding.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You need to decode text based on pairs of ASCII printable characters that are each other's encoding. Any character of text not available in one of the pairs is not encoded.

Example
test with the pairs
e a
f t
becomes fasf
Input
Line 1: string text: the text to decode.
Line 2: integer npairs, number of encoding pairs.
Next npairs lines: string pair, space separated pair of characters that are each other's encoding.
Output
String: decoded text.
Constraints
text consists only out of printable ASCII characters.
Characters in every pair are only printable ASCII characters, and every character in every pair is used maximum once.
0<=npairs<=10.
Example
Input
ecimple
2
a i
x c
Output
example
